title: Kessler: A Machine Learning Library for Spacecraft Collision Avoidance
authors: Giacomo Acciarini, Francesco Pinto, Francesca Letizia, Jose A. Martinez-Heras, Klaus Merz, Christopher Bridges, Atilim Gunes Baydin
relevance_note: ML library for spacecraft collision avoidance; provides systematic framework and evaluation methodology for CA decision-making using ESA CDM data.

title: Predicting the Probability of Collision of a Satellite with Space Debris: A Bayesian Machine Learning Approach
authors: Joao Simoes Catulo, Claudia Soares, Marta Guimaraes
relevance_note: Bayesian ML approach for collision probability prediction using CDM sequences; demonstrates Markov property of CDMs and uses Hidden Markov Models for risk estimation.

title: Deep Learning-Based Space Debris Detection for Space Situational Awareness: A Feasibility Study Applied to Radar Processing
authors: Federica Massimi, Pasquale Ferrara, Roberto Petrucci, Francesco Benedetto
relevance_note: Feasibility study of deep learning for debris detection in radar data; reveals challenges with noise, clutter, and generalization across different radar configurations.

title: Spacecraft Collision Avoidance Challenge: Design and Results of a Machine Learning Competition
authors: Thomas Uriot, Dario Izzo, Luis F. Simoes, Rasit Abay, Nils Einecke, Sven Rebhan, Jose Martinez-Heras, Francesca Letizia, Jan Siminski, Klaus Merz
relevance_note: ESA ML competition for CA using CDM data; documents competition design, winning approaches, and key challenges including data imbalance and operationalization gaps.

title: NASA CARA Compendium for Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning for Satellite Collision Avoidance
authors: Alinda K. Mashiku, Lauri K. Newman, Dolan E. Highsmith
relevance_note: Comprehensive NASA evaluation of ML/AI for CA using 450K+ CDMs; concludes ML has not shown operational promise due to class imbalance, stochastic orbital mechanics, data scarcity, and explainability gaps.

title: NASA Spacecraft Conjunction Assessment and Collision Avoidance Best Practices Handbook (Rev 1)
authors: NASA Office of the Chief Engineer
relevance_note: Authoritative handbook on operational CA practices; documents TLE limitations, covariance realism challenges, and decision-making frameworks that ML systems must integrate with. Rev 1 incorporates NPR 8079.1.

title: ESA's Annual Space Environment Report
authors: ESA Space Debris Office
relevance_note: Documents current debris population statistics (1M+ objects >1cm); quantifies catalog incompleteness and environment modeling uncertainty that directly affects ML training data quality.

title: IADC Report on the Status of the Space Debris Environment
authors: Inter-Agency Space Debris Coordination Committee (IADC)
relevance_note: International consensus report on debris environment; documents fragmentation events, mitigation compliance rates, and modeling discrepancies between agencies that affect ML dataset reliability.

title: Survey Mode: A Review of Machine Learning in Resident Space Object Detection and Characterization
authors: Konstantinos Tsaprailis, George Choumos, Vaios Lappas, Charalampos Kontoes
relevance_note: Comprehensive survey of ML methods for space surveillance and tracking; covers detection, classification, and characterization approaches with analysis of current limitations.

title: Machine Learning in Orbit Estimation: A Survey
authors: Francisco Caldas, Claudia Soares
relevance_note: Reviews ML techniques for orbit determination, prediction, and uncertainty propagation; covers EKF/UKF limitations and how ML approaches handle non-linear dynamics.

title: Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning for Space Domain Awareness: The Development of Two Artificial Intelligence Case Studies
authors: Jonathan Tran, Prateek Puri, Jordan Logue, Anthony Jacques, Li Ang Zhang, Krista Langeland, George Nacouzi, Gary J. Briggs
relevance_note: RAND analysis of AI/ML for SDA operations; addresses UQ needs, operator trust barriers, policy implications, and the gap between research prototypes and operational deployment.

title: Artificial Neural Network-Based Machine Learning Approach to Improve Orbit Prediction Accuracy
authors: Hao Peng, Xiaoli Bai
venue: Journal of Spacecraft and Rockets, Vol. 55, No. 5 (AIAA)
relevance_note: Investigates ANN for improving orbit prediction using simulated catalog data; demonstrates data quality impacts on ML performance and generalization challenges across different RSOs.

title: Precise and Efficient Orbit Prediction in LEO with Machine Learning using Exogenous Variables
authors: Francisco Caldas, Claudia Soares
relevance_note: Proposes ML orbit prediction using exogenous atmospheric variables; demonstrates SGP4 limitations and how atmospheric drag uncertainty propagates through ML predictions.

title: Expandable Orbit Decay Prediction Using Continual Learning
authors: Junhua He, Hua Wang, Haitao Wang, Xuankun Fang, Chengyi Huo
relevance_note: Addresses catastrophic forgetting in ML for orbit decay prediction using continual learning (EWC); demonstrates how physical parameter uncertainty limits traditional and ML-based approaches.

title: Uncertainty Quantification Techniques for Data-Driven Space Weather Modeling: Thermospheric Density Application
authors: Richard J. Licata, Piyush M. Mehta
relevance_note: Develops MC dropout and direct probability distribution prediction for thermospheric density UQ; directly relevant to satellite drag and collision probability computation in LEO.

title: Rapid and Uncertainty Quantified Orbital Propagation Using Uncertainty-Aware AI
authors: Kevin Vanslette, Austen Lay, Daniel Kusterer, Kris Schroeder
relevance_note: Demonstrates uncertainty-aware deep neural networks for orbital propagation with 1000x speedup over Orekit; shows well-calibrated covariance predictions for outlier detection.

title: RGB-D Based Multi-Modal Deep Learning for Spacecraft and Debris Recognition
authors: Nouar AlDahoul, Hezerul Abdul Karim, Mhd Adel Momo
relevance_note: Multi-modal deep learning for space object classification combining RGB and depth data; achieves 85% accuracy but reveals challenges with diverse sensing conditions and object sizes.

title: Towards a Machine Learning-Based Approach to Predict Space Object Density Distributions
authors: Victor Rodriguez-Fernandez, Sumiyajav Sarangerel, Peng Mun Siew, Pablo Machuca, Daniel Jang, Richard Linares
relevance_note: Uses autoencoders, RNNs, and transformers to predict space object density evolution; identifies challenges with long-term forecasting, generalization to unseen scenarios, and artifact generation.

title: Conjunction Assessment: NASA Best Practices and Lessons Learned
authors: Lauri K. Newman, Alinda K. Mashiku, Daniel E. Oltrogge
relevance_note: Documents operational lessons from NASA CA program; covers TLE limitations, trackability requirements, coordination challenges, and gaps ML must address for operational integration.

title: Instability of the Present LEO Satellite Populations
authors: J.-C. Liou, N.L. Johnson
venue: Advances in Space Research, Vol. 41, No. 7, pp. 1046-1053 (Elsevier)
relevance_note: Modern validation of Kessler Syndrome using NASA LEGEND model with 150 Monte Carlo runs; demonstrates that even with no future launches, LEO debris population will grow through collisions â€” establishes the self-sustaining instability that motivates ML-based tracking and prediction systems.
